flawed_nl_solution:
Book 1 was $13 and book 2 was $15 so 13 +15 = $28
He was buying 4 books, so these 2 were {discount_percent*100}% off so 28 * 0.25 = $7
These two books came out to 28-7 = $<<28-7=18>>18
Books 3 & 4 were both $10 each so 2*10 = $20
When you add all 4 books together, 18+20 = $<<18+20=38>>38
To get free shipping he would need to spend 50-38 = $<<50-38=12>>12 more on books

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 21.0, not 18.0. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
